reg_info.full_title: R.R.O. 1990, Reg. 708: COUNTY AND DISTRICT LAW ASSOCIATIONS

content.content: 1. - 23. Revoked:  O. Reg. 32/99, s. 2. County and District Law Associations definitions
content.raw_html:
1. - 23. Revoked:  O. Reg. 32/99, s. 2.

County and District Law Associations

definitions

content.content: 24. (1) In this section and in section 25, “association” means a county or district law association; (“association”) “county” includes a union of counties and a territorial district; (“comté”) “trustees”, where an association is incorporated, means the directors of the corporation. (“administrateurs”)  O. Reg. 656/00, s. 1. (2) Section 151.1 of the Courts of Justice Act applies, with necessary modifications, to this section and section 25.  O. Reg. 368/02, s. 1. formation
content.raw_html:
24. (1) In this section and in section 25,

“association” means a county or district law association; (“association”)

“county” includes a union of counties and a territorial district; (“comté”)

“trustees”, where an association is incorporated, means the directors of the corporation. (“administrateurs”)  O. Reg. 656/00, s. 1.

(2) Section 151.1 of the Courts of Justice Act applies, with necessary modifications, to this section and section 25.  O. Reg. 368/02, s. 1.

formation

content.content: 25. (1) The members of the Society in any county or any part thereof may, with the approval of Convocation, form an association and elect the trustees thereof.  R.R.O. 1990, Reg. 708, s. 25 (1). (2) At the time of the formation of an association or at any time thereafter, upon and in accordance with the request of Convocation, the trustees shall cause the association to be incorporated.  R.R.O. 1990, Reg. 708, s. 25 (2). (3) Upon formation, an association shall send to the Secretary a certified copy of its constitution and by-laws and thereafter shall send all amendments thereto as they are made, and, upon incorporation, an association shall send to the Secretary a certified copy of its letters patent and by-laws and thereafter shall send all amendments thereto as they are made.  R.R.O. 1990, Reg. 708, s. 25 (3); O. Reg. 656/00, s. 2.
content.raw_html:
25. (1) The members of the Society in any county or any part thereof may, with the approval of Convocation, form an association and elect the trustees thereof.  R.R.O. 1990, Reg. 708, s. 25 (1).

(2) At the time of the formation of an association or at any time thereafter, upon and in accordance with the request of Convocation, the trustees shall cause the association to be incorporated.  R.R.O. 1990, Reg. 708, s. 25 (2).

(3) Upon formation, an association shall send to the Secretary a certified copy of its constitution and by-laws and thereafter shall send all amendments thereto as they are made, and, upon incorporation, an association shall send to the Secretary a certified copy of its letters patent and by-laws and thereafter shall send all amendments thereto as they are made.  R.R.O. 1990, Reg. 708, s. 25 (3); O. Reg. 656/00, s. 2.
